title: Netflix Is Making Video Games But Nobody Is Playing?

media:group.media:title: Netflix Is Making Video Games But Nobody Is Playing?
media:group.media:description:
Is Netflix Games A Total FAILURE Or Can It Still Succeed?

The gaming industry has seen many trends come and go. One trend that has managed to stick around as of late is the game pass subscription model. 

From Ubisoft+ to the Xbox Game Pass, the ability to play games without having to invest $60 to $100 every time a new title is released has proven to be a great option for gamers who want to save money.

While the prices vary between services, the game subscription model has also made its way into mobile games with the Apple Arcade and Google Play Pass. 

Apple and Google have a duopoly on the mobile game market with their respective app stores, but one company is trying to enter the mobile game market and compete with its own subscription service. That company is Netflix.
